AudioBitrateMatches.Description: Check if an audio bitrate matches the constraints.
AudioBitrateMatches.Label: Audio Bitrate Matches

Fields.BitrateKilobytes-Help: The bitrate in kilobytes to run the match against.

AudioFile.Description: An input Audio file that has had its Audio Information read and can be processed
AudioFile.Label: Audio File

AudioFileNormalization.Description: Normalizes an audio file using two passes of FFMPEGs loudnorm filter
AudioFileNormalization.Label: Audio File Normalization

Outputs.1: Audio file normalized and saved to temporary file

ConvertAudio.Description: Convert a Audio file to the specified audio codec
ConvertAudio.Label: Convert Audio

Fields.Bitrate-Help: The bitrate for the new file, the higher the bitrate the better the quality but larger the file.
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels the converted file will have.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically up-mix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically down-mix it.
Fields.Codec-Help: The audio codec to convert the file into.
Fields.CustomExtension-Help: Allows you to set a custom file extension to use instead of the automatic one determined by the codec.
Fields.HighEfficiency-Help: Will use high efficiency mode, this will change the extension to m4a and will reduce supported playback devices, but may reduce the size of the file.
Fields.Normalize-Help: If the audio should be normalized with two pass audio normalization
Fields.SkipIfCodecMatches-Help: If the existing audio codec matches, this file will not be processed regardless of the bitrate.  Otherwise if off, the bitrate must be less than or equal to for it to skip.

Outputs.1: Audio converted and saved to temporary file
Outputs.2: Audio already in codec, no conversion done

ConvertToAAC.Description: Convert a Audio file to AAC
ConvertToAAC.Label: Convert To AAC

Fields.Bitrate-Help: The bitrate for the new AAC file, the higher the bitrate the better the quality but larger the file.  192 Kbps is the recommended rate.
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels the converted file will have.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically up-mix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically down-mix it.
Fields.CustomExtension-Help: Allows you to set a custom file extension to use instead of the automatic one determined by the codec.
Fields.HighEfficiency-Help: Will use high efficiency mode, this will change the extension to m4a and will reduce supported playback devices, but may reduce the size of the file.
Fields.Normalize-Help: If the audio should be normalized with two pass audio normalization
Fields.SkipIfCodecMatches-Help: If the existing audio codec matches, this file will not be processed regardless of the bitrate.  Otherwise if off, the bitrate must be less than or equal to for it to skip.

Outputs.1: Audio converted and saved to temporary file
Outputs.2: Audio already in codec, no conversion done

ConvertToFLAC.Description: Convert a Audio file to FLAC
ConvertToFLAC.Label: Convert To FLAC

Fields.Bitrate-Help: The bitrate for the new FLAC file, the higher the bitrate the better the quality but larger the file.  128 Kbps is the recommended rate.
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels the converted file will have.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically up-mix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically down-mix it.
Fields.CustomExtension-Help: Allows you to set a custom file extension to use instead of the automatic one determined by the codec.
Fields.Normalize-Help: If the audio should be normalized with two pass audio normalization
Fields.SkipIfCodecMatches-Help: If the existing audio codec matches, this file will not be processed regardless of the bitrate.  Otherwise if off, the bitrate must be less than or equal to for it to skip.

Outputs.1: Audio converted and saved to temporary file
Outputs.2: Audio already in codec, no conversion done

ConvertToMP3.Description: Convert a Audio file to MP3
ConvertToMP3.Label: Convert To MP3

Fields.Bitrate-Help: The bitrate for the new MP3 file, the higher the bitrate the better the quality but larger the file.  192 Kbps is the recommended rate.
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels the converted file will have.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically up-mix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically down-mix it.
Fields.CustomExtension-Help: Allows you to set a custom file extension to use instead of the automatic one determined by the codec.
Fields.Normalize-Help: If the audio should be normalized with two pass audio normalization
Fields.SkipIfCodecMatches-Help: If the existing audio codec matches, this file will not be processed regardless of the bitrate.  Otherwise if off, the bitrate must be less than or equal to for it to skip.

Outputs.1: Audio converted and saved to temporary file
Outputs.2: Audio already in codec, no conversion done

ConvertToOGG.Description: Convert a Audio file to OGG
ConvertToOGG.Label: Convert To OGG

Fields.Bitrate-Help: The bitrate for the new OGG file, the higher the bitrate the better the quality but larger the file.  128 Kbps is the recommended rate.
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels the converted file will have.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically up-mix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically down-mix it.
Fields.CustomExtension-Help: Allows you to set a custom file extension to use instead of the automatic one determined by the codec.
Fields.Normalize-Help: If the audio should be normalized with two pass audio normalization
Fields.SkipIfCodecMatches-Help: If the existing audio codec matches, this file will not be processed regardless of the bitrate.  Otherwise if off, the bitrate must be less than or equal to for it to skip.

Outputs.1: Audio converted and saved to temporary file
Outputs.2: Audio already in codec, no conversion done

ConvertToWAV.Description: Convert a Audio file to WAV
ConvertToWAV.Label: Convert To WAV

Fields.Bitrate-Help: The bitrate for the new WAV file, the higher the bitrate the better the quality but larger the file.  128 Kbps is the recommended rate.
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels the converted file will have.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically up-mix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFmpeg will automatically down-mix it.
Fields.CustomExtension-Help: Allows you to set a custom file extension to use instead of the automatic one determined by the codec.
Fields.Normalize-Help: If the audio should be normalized with two pass audio normalization
Fields.SkipIfCodecMatches-Help: If the existing audio codec matches, this file will not be processed regardless of the bitrate.  Otherwise if off, the bitrate must be less than or equal to for it to skip.

Outputs.1: Audio converted and saved to temporary file
Outputs.2: Audio already in codec, no conversion done

CreateAudioBook.Description: Creates a audio book from audio files found in input directory
CreateAudioBook.Label: Create Audio Book

Fields.DeleteSourceFiles-Help: When enabled the source files that make up the newly created m4b file will be deleted, otherwise they will be left alone.
Fields.DestinationPath-Help: The destination where to save the newly created file.  If left empty the file will be created in the temporary directory and will be deleted if not moved afterwards.
Fields.UpdateWorkingFile-Help: When enabled the working file will be updated to the newly created file.

EmbedArtwork.Description: Embeds artwork into an audio file
EmbedArtwork.Label: Embed Artwork

Outputs.1: Artwork found and embedded into the audio file

BatchScript.Description: Allows you to execute a batch (.bat) script in a Windows environment.
BatchScript.Label: Batch Script (.bat)

CopyFile.Description: Copies a file to the destination folder
CopyFile.Label: Copy File

Fields.AdditionalFiles-Help:
Additional files to copy from the directory to the new directory.
Each value can contain a combination of valid literal path and wildcard (* and ?) characters, but it doesn''t support regular expressions.
Fields.AdditionalFilesFromOriginal-Help: If the additional files should be copied from the working directory or from the original directory.  Turn on for original directory.
Fields.CopyFolder-Help: If the relative library folder structure should be copied too
Fields.DestinationFile-Help: The filename to copy the file to.  If empty, the original filename will be used
Fields.DestinationPath-Help: The folder where the file will be copied to
Fields.InputFile-Help: The file to copy, if left empty then the working file will be copied
Fields.PreserverOriginalDates-Help: If the original creation time and last write time of the original input file should be preserved.

CSharpScript.Description: Allows you to execute a C# code inside the Flow.
CSharpScript.Label: C# Function

Fields.FileName-Help:
A path to either a file or folder to delete.

If left blank the current working file will be deleted.

DeleteSourceDirectory.Description: Deletes the source folder of the original library file
DeleteSourceDirectory.Label: Delete Source Folder

Fields.IfEmpty-Help: Only delete the source folder if the it is empty
Fields.IncludePatterns-Help: Optional, if set only files matching these patterns will be counted to see if the folder is empty.   Any of these patterns can match.
Fields.TopMostOnly-Help: When enabled, only the folder directly containing the file will be deleted, leaving higher-level folders intact.

Executor.Description:
Execute the following process against the file.
Output 1: The process returned the success exit code
Output 2: The process return a non-successful exit code.
Executor.Label: Executor

Fields.Arguments-Help: The arguments to be passed to the process to execute
Fields.FileName-Help: The name of the file to execute
Fields.OutputErrorVariable-Help: An optional variable name to store the process error output into
Fields.OutputVariable-Help: An optional variable name to store the process output into
Fields.SuccessCode-Help: The exit code of the process indicating the process was successful.  Usually this should be 0.
Fields.Timeout-Help: How long the process can run for before being terminated.  Use 0 for no timeout.
Fields.WorkingDirectory-Help: The folder where the process will be executed from

FailFlow.Description: Fails a flow immediately, useful if you want a certain path to just fail.
FailFlow.Label: Fail Flow

Fields.Reason-Help: An optional reason to record why the flow failed.

FileDateCompare.Description: Checks if the file creation or last write time matches the specified date constraint.
FileDateCompare.Label: File Date Compare

Fields.FileName-Help: The file to check.  Leave empty to check the current working file.

Outputs.2: Does not match the date constraint.

FileExists.Description:
Checks if a file exists

Output 1: File exists
Output 2: File does not exist
FileExists.Label: File Exists

Fields.FileName-Help: The file to check.  Leave empty to check the current working file.

FileExtension.Description:
Checks if the file has one of the configured extensions.

Output 1: Matches
Output 2: Does not match
FileExtension.Label: File Extension

Fields.Extensions-Help:
A list of case insensitive file extensions that will be matched against.
Output 1 Matches
Output 2: Does not match

FileNameMatches.Description: Checks if the original file name (including the full path) matches the specified value using string operations.
FileNameMatches.Label: File Name Matches

Fields.Value-Help: Specify the value to match against. Variables are supported, and matching uses string operations.

FileSize.Description:
Checks if the file size matches the configured parameters. The values are in megabytes.

Output 1: Matches
Output 2: Does not match
FileSize.Label: File Size

Fields.Lower-Help: The value it must be greater than this number of megabytes
Fields.Upper-Help: The value it must be less than than this number of megabytes. Leave as 0 to not test the upper limit.

FileSizeCompare.Description: Checks if the file size has changed sized from the original file.
FileSizeCompare.Label: File Size Compare

FileSizeWithin.Description: Checks if the new file size is within the allowed range of the original file size.
FileSizeWithin.Label: File Size Within

Fields.Value-Help: The difference allowed for the file size, this value can be either plus or minus this difference.

Outputs.1: File size is within allowed range
Outputs.2: File size is not within allowed range

FolderDateCompare.Description: Checks if the folder creation or last write time matches the specified date constraint.
FolderDateCompare.Label: Folder Date Compare

Fields.Path-Help:
The path to the folder to check.  Leave empty to check the current working file.
If a file is specified the folder containing the file will be checked.

Outputs.2: Does not match the date constraint.

FolderIterator.Description: Iterates all files in a given folder and executes those files against a sub flow.
FolderIterator.Label: Folder Iterator

Fields.Flow-Help: The sub flow to execute the files against.
Fields.Folder-Help: The folder whose files will be iterated.
Fields.Pattern-Help: Any optional pattern to limit the files for iteration, this can be a wildcard pattern starting with a `*` or a regular expression.
Fields.Recursive-Help: If files in all sub folders should also be iterated, or if only the top level files should be iterated.

Fields.Code-Help: return -1 for error and flow to stop.  return 0 for flow to complete.  return 1 or more for the desired output to be called
Fields.Template-Help: WARNING: This will replace whatever is in the code block with the template you select.

GotoFlow.Description: This lets you switch to a different flow to process.  This flow will exit and the parameters and working file will be passed into the new Flow
GotoFlow.Label: Goto Flow

Fields.UpdateFlowUsed-Help: If the files `Flow` should be updated to reference this new Flow or leave it as the original Flow.

HasHardLinks.Description: Checks if a file has hard links to it or not
HasHardLinks.Label: Has Hard Links

Fields.Count-Help: The number of hard links required to call output 1.
Fields.FileName-Help: The file to check.  Leave empty to check the current working file.

IfBoolean.Description: Tests if a Variable is true or false
IfBoolean.Label: If Boolean

Fields.Variable-Help: The name of the variable to check

IfString.Description: Tests if a Variable is matches a string
IfString.Label: If String

Fields.Outputs-Help: This should match the number of options there are
Fields.Variable-Help: The name of the variable to check

InputFile.Description: An input flow element for a file.  This is required and is the starting point of a flow.  Any input flow element can be used, just one is required.
InputFile.Label: Input File

InputFolder.Description: An input flow element for a folder.  This will only work if the library using this flow is configured for folders.
InputFolder.Label: Input Folder

IsDocker.Description: Determines if this flow is running on Docker
IsDocker.Label: Is Docker

IsFromLibrary.Description: Checks if the file that is processing is from the specified library.
IsFromLibrary.Label: Is From Library

Outputs.1: File is from the specified library.
Outputs.2: File is not from the specified library.

IsLinux.Description: Determines if this flow is running on Linux
IsLinux.Label: Is Linux

IsMacOS.Description: Determines if this flow is running on MacOS
IsMacOS.Label: Is MacOS

IsProcessingOnNode.Description: Checks if the flow is currently processing on a specified processing node.
IsProcessingOnNode.Label: Is Processing On Node

IsWindows.Description: Determines if this flow is running on Windows
IsWindows.Label: Is Windows

ListIterator.Description: Iterates all strings in a given list and executes those strings against a sub flow.
ListIterator.Label: List Iterator

Fields.Flow-Help: The sub flow to execute the strings against.
Fields.List-Help: A name of a variable containing the list to iterate.

Log.Description: Logs a message to the flow log
Log.Label: Log

LogImage.Description: Logs an image to the file log
LogImage.Label: Log Image

Fields.ImageFile-Help: The image file to be logged

LogVariables.Description: Logs all the variables in the flow to the file log for debugging purposes.
LogVariables.Label: Log Variables

Fields.Recursive-Help: When enabled, complex variables will include all their nested properties in the log.

Matches.Description: Compares a set of values and matches conditions to see which output should be called
Matches.Label: Matches

Fields.MatchConditions-Help: The matches to test which output should be called.

MatchesAll.Description: Compares a set of values and checks if all conditions match.
MatchesAll.Label: Matches All

Fields.MatchConditionsHelp: The conditions to test, determining which output should be called.

MoveFile.Description: Moves a file to the destination folder
MoveFile.Label: Move File

Fields.AdditionalFiles-Help:
Additional files to move from the directory to the new directory.
Each value can contain a combination of valid literal path and wildcard (* and ?) characters, but it doesn''t support regular expressions.
Fields.AdditionalFilesFromOriginal-Help: If the additional files should be moved from the working directory or from the original directory.  Turn on for original directory.
Fields.DeleteOriginal-Help: If the original file should be deleted, this will only happen if the working file is different to the original file
Fields.DestinationFile-Help: The filename to move the file to.  If empty, the original filename will be used
Fields.DestinationPath-Help: The folder where the file will be moved to
Fields.InputFile-Help: The file to move, if left empty then the working file will be moved
Fields.MoveFolder-Help: If the relative library folder structure should be copied too
Fields.PreserverOriginalDates-Help: If the original creation time and last write time of the original input file should be preserved.

Outputs.2: File moved, however original file could not be deleted

Fields.CreateSubfolder-Help: If a subfolder with the name of the source folder will be created in the destination folder.
Fields.DestinationPath-Help: The destination folder to move the source folder to.
Fields.SourcePath-Help: The folder to move, if left blank the Working File will be used, if this is not a folder, then the flow element will fail.

OlderThan.Description: Checks if a folder is older than the range specified
OlderThan.Label: Older Than

OriginalFile.Description: Sets the current working file in the flow to the original file that started the flow
OriginalFile.Label: Original File

Outputs.1: Working file set to original file

PatternMatch.Description:
Tests the working file and original file against a regular expression.

Output 1: Matches expression
Output 2: Does not match
PatternMatch.Label: Pattern Match

Fields.Pattern-Help: A regular expression, using the C# specification for regular expressions.

PatternReplacer.Description:
Lets you make replacements in the filename.  Can use regular expressions for replacements, or simple string replacements.

Output 1: Replacement done
Output 2: No replacement done
PatternReplacer.Label: Filename Pattern Replacer

Fields.UseWorkingFileName-Help: If current working filename should be used, or if false, the original filename of the incoming file will be used.

PowerShellScript.Description: Allows you to execute a PowerShell (.ps1) script in a Windows environment.
PowerShellScript.Label: PowerShell Script (.ps1)

Fields.Outputs-Help: The number of outputs that could possible be called.

Renamer.Description:
Renames the working file.
Variables can be used by entering the key '{' inside the Pattern field.
Renamer.Label: Renamer

Fields.CsvFile-Help: Will append to this file the original name and the renamed file.  Useful when using ''Log Only'' to test the renamer before changing files.
Fields.DestinationPath-Help: If the file should be moved to a different folder.
Fields.LogOnly-Help: Turn on if you just want to test this flow element without it actually renaming the file
Fields.Pattern-Help: The new name of the file.  Can use variables. Any empty () and '{}' will be removed.

ReplaceOriginal.Description:
Replaces the original file with the working file.

If the extension is different on the working file, the original file will be deleted and the working file will be moved to the original with the new extension.
E.g. from File.avi to File.mkv
ReplaceOriginal.Label: Replace Original

Fields.PreserverOriginalDates-Help: If the original creation time and last write time of the original input file should be preserved.

Reprocess.Description:
The flow element allows you to reprocess the original library file with a different processing node.

 If the same processing node is selected as the one currently processing the file, the flow will fail.
Reprocess.Label: Reprocess

Fields.HoldMinutes-Help: The number of minutes to hold the file before processing it again.  Use 0 to process immediately.
Fields.Node-Help: The processing node to process this file.

SetVariable.Description: Sets a variable in the flow.
SetVariable.Label: Set Variable

Fields.Value-Help: The value of the variable to set.
Fields.Variable-Help: The name of the variable to set

SetWorkingFile.Description: Updates the current working file to the one specified.
SetWorkingFile.Label: Set Working File

Fields.DontDeletePrevious-Help:
If the previous *temporary* working file should *not* be deleted.
Only temporary files will be deleted, files that have been created by FileFlows into the runners temporary directory.
Fields.File-Description: The path to the new working file or folder.

Fields.CompressionLevel-Help: The level of compression to use when compressing the level.
Fields.CompressionMethod-Help: The compression method used for compression, LZMA2 is recommended.
Fields.DestinationFile-Help: The filename of the newly created 7zip.  If blank, the name of the item will be used as the 7zip file.
Fields.DestinationPath-Help: The destination folder where to put the 7zip file.  If blank, the 7zip will be placed in the library root.

ShellScript.Description: Allows you to execute a shell (.sh) script in a Unix-like environment.
ShellScript.Label: Shell Script (.sh)

Fields.Milliseconds-Help: How long to sleep the flow for.  Must be between 1 millisecond and 1 hour

Tag.Description: Tags the file with the specified tags
Tag.Label: Tag

Fields.Replace-Help: If the tags should be replaced or appended to the existing tags.

Touch.Description: Touches a file or directory and sets the last write time to now.
Touch.Label: Touch

Fields.FileName-Help:
Full filename of file or folder to touch.
If left blank the working file will be used.

Unpack.Description: Allows you to unpack an archive (zip, rar, tar, etc)
Unpack.Label: Unpack

Fields.DestinationPath-Help: The destination folder where to unpack the file.
Fields.File-Help: The name of the file to unpack.  Can be left blank and if so the current working file will be used.

VariableMatch.Description: Tests if a input matches a stored Variable
VariableMatch.Label: Variable Match

Fields.Input-Help: The value to match the variable against.

WebRequest.Description: Allows you to send a web request
WebRequest.Label: Web Request

Fields.Body-Help: The body of the request being sent.  Variables can be used in this field.
Fields.ContentType-Help: The Content-Type of the message to send
Fields.Headers-Help: Optional headers to send with the request
Fields.Method-Help: The web method to use when sending this request
Fields.ResponseVariable-Help: The name of the variable where the JSON response will be stored. If the response is not valid JSON, this variable will not be set.

Outputs.2: Request returned a non-successful status code

Fields.File-Help: The file to write the text to.
Fields.Text-Help: The text to write to the file.  If left blank the current working file full path will be written.

Zip.Description: Allows you to zip the input
Zip.Label: Zip

Fields.DestinationFile-Help: The filename of the newly created zip.  If blank, the name of the item will be used as the zip file.
Fields.DestinationPath-Help: The destination folder where to put the zip file.  If blank, the zip will be placed in the library root.
Fields.Path-Help: The path to the file or folder to zip.  If blank, the working file will be zipped.
Fields.SetWorkingFile-Help: If the newly created zip should become the new working file.

Fields.Format-Help: The image format to convert to
Fields.Threshold-Help: Threshold for entropic density, default is 50.  Must be between 0 and 100.

Outputs.1: Image cropped, saved to new temporary file

Fields.Format-Help: The image format to convert to
Fields.Vertical-Help: If set the image will be flipped vertically, otherwise horizontally

Outputs.1: Image flipped, saved to new temporary file

ImageFormat.Description: Converts an image to the specified format
ImageFormat.Label: Image Format

Fields.Format-Help: The image format to convert to

Outputs.1: Image converted, saved to new temporary file

ImageIsLandscape.Description: Test if an image is landscape
ImageIsLandscape.Label: Image Is Landscape

ImageIsPortrait.Description: Test if an image is portrait
ImageIsPortrait.Label: Image Is Portrait

Fields.Format-Help: The image format to convert to
Fields.Mode-Help: The mode to use when resizing the image

Outputs.1: Image resized, saved to new temporary file

Fields.Format-Help: The image format to convert to

Outputs.1: Image rotated, saved to new temporary file

IsImage.Description: Tests if a file is an image file.
IsImage.Label: Is Image

Fields.File-Help: Optional path to the file to check, if left blank then the current working file will be checked.

Outputs.1: File is a recognized image file
Outputs.2: File is not a recognized image file

PixelCheck.Description: This flow element verifies if an image's total pixel count exceeds the specified threshold.
PixelCheck.Label: Pixel Check

Fields.Pixels-Help: The number of pixels an image should contain.  This is calculated by the width of the image multiplied by its height.

Outputs.1: Image has greater or equal to the number of pixels specified
Outputs.2: Image has fewer pixels number than the required pixels specified

AudioToVideo.Description: Converts an audio file into a video file and generates a video based on the audio
AudioToVideo.Label: Audio to Video

Fields.Color-Help: Optional #RRGGBB color code to use for the sound waves, must be in the format #RRGGBB, for example #FF0090
Fields.HardwareEncoding-Help: When checked, will test to see if hardware encoders are found on the Processing Node, and if found will use hardware encoding, otherwise will fallback to CPU encoding.
Fields.Visualization-Help: The visualization to use in the generated video.  See Help for examples

CanUseHardwareEncoding.Description: Checks if the specified hardware encoder is currently available to the Flow.
CanUseHardwareEncoding.Label: Can Use Hardware Encoding

ComskipRemoveAds.Description: Uses a comskip EDL file and will remove commercials using that file.
ComskipRemoveAds.Label: Comskip Remove Ads

Fields.RunComskipIfNoEdl-Help: Run comskip against the file if no comskip (EDL) file is found.

Outputs.1: Commercials removed, saved to temporary file

CreateThumbnail.Description: Creates a thumbnail image from a video file.
CreateThumbnail.Label: Create Thumbnail

Fields.Height-Help: The height of the thumbnail image.
Fields.OutputFile-Help: The file path where the thumbnail image will be saved. If left blank, a .jpg file will be created in the same location as the original file.
Fields.ResizeMode-Help: The method used for resizing the image.
Fields.SkipBlackFrames-Help: If enabled, the system will skip black frames and select another frame instead.
Fields.Time-Help: The time in the video from which to capture the thumbnail.
Fields.Width-Help: The width of the thumbnail image.

Fields.Pattern-Help: A regular expression used to search for input files
Fields.UseSourceDirectory-Help: If checked the original source directory will be searched, otherwise the working directory will be used.

Fields.AdjustmentMode-Help: Choose how the aspect ratio should be enforced. Options include stretching the video, adding black bars (letterbox), or cropping the video to fit the aspect ratio.
Fields.AspectRatio-Help: Select the desired aspect ratio for the video. Available options include standard aspect ratios (16:9, 4:3, 21:9) or a custom ratio.
Fields.CustomHeight-Help: Specify the height to use when selecting the custom aspect ratio option.
Fields.CustomWidth-Help: Specify the width to use when selecting the custom aspect ratio option.

Outputs.2: Video was already in the desired aspect ratio

FfmpegBuilderAudioAddTrack.Description: Adds a new audio track to FFMPEG Builder which will be added once the builder is executed.
FfmpegBuilderAudioAddTrack.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Audio Add Track

Fields.Bitrate-Help: Bitrate of the new audio track
Fields.BitratePerChannel-Help: If the bitrate specified should be per channel
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels this new audio track will be.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFMPEG will automatically upmix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFMPEG will automatically down mix it.
Fields.Codec-Help: The codec to use to encode the audio
Fields.Filter-Help: Specifies a custom filter to apply to this new audio track.
Fields.Index-Help: The index where to insert the new audio track.  0 based, so to insert the new audio track as the first track set this to 0.
Fields.Language-Help: Optional [ISO 639-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes) language code to use.  Will attempt to find an audio track with this language code if not the best audio track will be used.
Fields.NewTitle-Help: Optional title for the newly created audio track.  If left blank the source title will be used
Fields.RemoveTitle-Help: If the source title should be removed and the track should have no title
Fields.SampleRate-Help: The sample rate to use for the new audio track

Outputs.1: Added audio track to FFMPEG Builder
Outputs.2: No suitable source audio track found to create new audio track from

FfmpegBuilderAudioAdjustVolume.Description: Adjusts audio tracks volume in a video file using FFMPEG
FfmpegBuilderAudioAdjustVolume.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Audio Adjust Volume

Fields.AllAudio-Help: If all audio tracks should be normalized or if just the first track should be
Fields.NotMatching-Help: If audio tracks NOT matching the pattern should be removed
Fields.Pattern-Help: A regular expression to match against, eg "commentary" to remove commentary tracks
Fields.UseLanguageCode-Help: If the language code of the audio track should be used instead of the title
Fields.VolumePercent-Help:
The percent of the adjusted volume.
100 means no adjustment
50 means half volume
0 means muted

Outputs.1: Audio tracks volume filter added to FFMPEG Builder

FfmpegBuilderAudioConvert.Description: Allows you to convert all tracks matching the parameters to be converted.
FfmpegBuilderAudioConvert.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Audio Convert

Fields.BitratePerChannel-Help: If the bitrate specified should be per channel
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels this new audio track will be.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFMPEG will automatically upmix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFMPEG will automatically down mix it.
Fields.Codec-Help: The codec to use to encode the audio
Fields.PcmFormat-Help: The PCM format to use for encoding PCM audio.

FfmpegBuilderAudioConverter.Description: Allows you to convert all tracks matching the parameters to be converted.
FfmpegBuilderAudioConverter.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Audio Converter

Fields.BitratePerChannel-Help: If the bitrate specified should be per channel
Fields.Channels-Help:
The number of channels this new audio track will be.
If you specify more channels than the source, FFMPEG will automatically upmix it.
If you specify fewer channels than the source, FFMPEG will automatically down mix it.
Fields.Codec-Help: The codec to use to encode the audio
Fields.Field-Help: The field to match the pattern against.  Leave the pattern empty to match anything with no value set.
Fields.NotMatching-Help: If audio tracks NOT matching the pattern should be converted
Fields.Pattern-Help: A string or regular expression to match against, eg "commentary" to match commentary exactly or ".*commentary.*" to match commentary anywhere in the string
Fields.PcmFormat-Help: The PCM format to use for encoding PCM audio.

FfmpegBuilderAudioNormalization.Description: Normalizes all audio tracks in a video file using FFMPEGs loudnorm filter
FfmpegBuilderAudioNormalization.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Audio Normalization

Fields.AllAudio-Help: If all audio tracks should be normalized or if just the first track should be
Fields.NotMatching-Help: If audio tracks NOT matching the pattern should be removed
Fields.Pattern-Help: A regular expression to match against, eg "commentary" to remove commentary tracks
Fields.TwoPass-Help: If the audio tracks should use two pass normalization.  This improves the normalization but increases the processing time.
Fields.UseLanguageCode-Help: If the language code of the audio track should be used instead of the title

Outputs.1: Audio tracks were normalized and added to FFMPEG Builder
Outputs.2: No audio tracks were found to be normalized

FfmpegBuilderAudioSetLanguage.Description:
Allows you to set the language for any tracks that have no language set.  If the track does have a language set, it will be skipped.

Output 1: Tracks were updated
Output 2: No tracks were needing to be updated
FfmpegBuilderAudioSetLanguage.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Set Language

Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of track to set the language for

FfmpegBuilderAudioTrackRemover.Description:
Allows you to remove tracks based on either their title or their language codes.

Any title (or language code if set to "Use Language Code") that is blank will NOT be removed regardless of the pattern.
FfmpegBuilderAudioTrackRemover.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Track Remover (Obsolete)

Fields.NotMatching-Help: If audio tracks NOT matching the pattern should be removed
Fields.Pattern-Help: A regular expression to match against, eg "commentary" to remove commentary tracks
Fields.RemoveAll-Help: Remove all current tracks from the output file.  You can use Add Track afterwards to add tracks of specific codecs
Fields.RemoveIndex-Help:
The start index where to remove the tracks from.  This allows you to remove all, or all matching, tracks after the starting index.
Set to zero to remove all matching the parameters.
Set to 1 to keep the first track and remove any after the first matching the parameters
Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of tracks to reorder in the FFMPEG Builder
Fields.UseLanguageCode-Help: If the language code of the track should be used instead of the title

FfmpegBuilderAudioTrackReorder.Description:
Allows you to reorder tracks in the preferred order.

Enter the languages/audio codecs/channels in the order you want.  Any not listed will be ordered after the ones entered in their original order.
If there are multiple tracks with same language/codec/channels, they will be ordered first by the order you entered, then in their original order.

Note the first track after reordering will be set as the default track..

Output 1: Tracks were reordered
Output 2: Tracks did not need reordering
FfmpegBuilderAudioTrackReorder.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Track Reorder

Fields.Channels-Help:
The order of audio channels to sort the audio tracks by.  This sorting is done before languages.
For example "5.1","7.1","6.2","2"
Fields.Languages-Help: The order of languages to sort the tracks by.  This sorting is done before the codec.
Fields.OrderedTracks-Help: The order of codecs to the tracks by.  This is done after the languages (if any)
Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of tracks to reorder in the FFMPEG Builder

FfmpegBuilderAutoChapters.Description: Automatically detect scene changes in the video to generate chapters.
FfmpegBuilderAutoChapters.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Auto Chapters

Fields.MinimumLength-Help: The minimum length of a chapter in seconds
Fields.Percent-Help: The threshold percentage value to use for scene detection changes.  A good value is 45%

Outputs.1: Chapters generated and added to FFMPEG Builder
Outputs.2: No chapters detected or video already had chapters

FfmpegBuilderComskipChapters.Description: Uses a comskip EDL file and will create chapters given that EDL comskip file.
FfmpegBuilderComskipChapters.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Comskip Chapters

Fields.RunComskipIfNoEdl-Help: Run comskip against the file if no comskip (EDL) file is found.

Outputs.1: Commercials chapters created, added to FFMPEG Builder

FfmpegBuilderCropBlackBars.Description: Updated FFMPEG Builder to crop black bars if detected
FfmpegBuilderCropBlackBars.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Crop Black Bars

Fields.CroppingThreshold-Help: The amount of pixels that must be greater than to crop.   E.g. if there's only 5 pixels detected as black space, you may consider this too small to crop.

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder updated to crop black bars
Outputs.2: No black bars detected, not cropping

FfmpegBuilderCustomParameters.Description: Lets you add custom parameters to the FFMPEG Builder for execution
FfmpegBuilderCustomParameters.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Custom Parameters

Fields.ForceEncode-Help: If this should force the FFMPEG Builder Executor to always execute even if no changes are detected that would usually require the executor to run.
Fields.Parameters-Help: The parameters to add to the FFMPEG Builder for execution

FfmpegBuilderDefaultOriginalLanguage.Description:
This flow element will attempt to set the original language tracks as default.  It will try to find the first track matching the original language, and then set that as default.

If no tracks are found with the original language, then no changes are made.
FfmpegBuilderDefaultOriginalLanguage.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Default Original Language

Fields.MakeFirst-Help: If the original language track should also become the first track.
Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of tracks that should be updated

Fields.Mode-Help: The deinterlacing method to use.  See help for more information.

Outputs.1: Added deinterlace filter to video stream

FFmpegBuilderDurationStart.Descriptions: This flow element enables users to define the starting point and duration for extracting a segment from a video.
FFmpegBuilderDurationStart.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Duration/Start

Fields.Duration-Help: The duration of the video file, if 0, will not adjust the duration.
Fields.Start-Help: The start of the video file, if 0, will not adjust the start.

FfmpegBuilderExecutor.Description: Executes a FFMPEG Builder command created by other FFMPEG Builder flow elements.
FfmpegBuilderExecutor.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Executor

Fields.HardwareDecoding-Help: If the executor should attempt to use hardware decoding.  If not available the execution will proceed just without hardware decoding enabled.
Fields.KeepModel-Help: Determines whether to retain the FFmpeg Builder model used to construct the FFmpeg command. When disabled, the model will be removed after the flow element successfully completes (i.e., no failure occurs).
Fields.Strictness-Help: Allows you to customize the strictness of FFmpeg.  This should be left on 'Experimental' for most users.

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder ran successfully and created new temporary file
Outputs.2: No changes detected in FFMPEG Builder, file not created

FfmpegBuilderHdrToSdr.Description: Checks if a video stream is HDR and if it is updates the FFMPEG Builder to convert it to SDR
FfmpegBuilderHdrToSdr.Label: FFMPEG Builder: HDR to SDR

Outputs.1: HDR stream detected and updated FFMPEG Builder to convert

FfmpegBuilderKeepOriginalLanguage.Description:
This flow element that will keep only the original language and any additional languages the user defines.

All other language streams will be removed/marked for deletion.
FfmpegBuilderKeepOriginalLanguage.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Keep Original Language

Fields.AdditionalLanguages-Help:
An optional list of additional language codes to keep.

It is recommended that an [ISO 639-2 language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes) are used.
Fields.FirstIfNone-Help:
When enabled, this ensures at least one track is kept.  If no tracks matching the original language and no tracks matching the additional languages are found, the first track will be kept regardless.

This avoids any issues of no audio left on the video.
Fields.KeepOnlyFirst-Help:
When enabled only the first track of each language would be kept.

For example if there were 2 English tracks, 3 Spanish tracks and 1 German track.  The original language was Spanish, additional languages was set to `eng`, then the result would be 1 English track and 1 Spanish track, the rest would be removed.
Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of tracks that should be updated
Fields.TreatEmptyAsOriginal-Help:
When enabled, any track that has no language set, will be treated as if it were the original language.

For example, original language is Maori, and a track has no language set on it, it will be treated as Maori.

FFmpegBuilderLanguageRemover.Description: A basic flow element that removes unwanted audio and/or subtitles from a video file based on the specified languages.
FFmpegBuilderLanguageRemover.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Language Remover

Fields.Languages-Help: A list of languages to either remove or keep, depending on the Not Matching option.
Fields.NotMatching-Help: Indicates whether to remove audio tracks that do NOT match the specified languages.
Fields.StreamType-Help: Specifies the type of tracks (audio or subtitles) to remove in the FFMPEG Builder.

FfmpegBuilderMetadataRemover.Description:
Removes metadata from the FFMPEG Builder so when the file is processed the selected metadata will be removed.

Note: Only the metadata when this flow element is effected, if metadata is added after this node runs, that will not be effected.
FfmpegBuilderMetadataRemover.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Metadata Remover

Fields.Audio-Help: If audio tracks should have this metadata removed
Fields.RemoveAdditionalMetadata-Help: If additional metadata should be removed.  Additional metadata is non-standard metadata that may have been added to a video file, eg by iTunes.
Fields.RemoveImages-Help: If any images found in the metadata should be removed
Fields.RemoveLanguage-Help: If the language should be removed from the tracks
Fields.RemoveTitle-Help: If the title should be removed from the tracks
Fields.Subtitle: Subtitle
Fields.Subtitle-Help: If subtitle tracks should have this metadata removed
Fields.Video-Help: If video tracks should have this metadata removed

FfmpegBuilderPreExecute.Description:
This element lets you run custom code just prior to the [FFmpeg Builder: Executor](https://fileflows.com/docs/plugins/video-nodes/ffmpeg-builder) executes FFmpeg.

This allows you to alter the arguments passed into FFmpeg.
FfmpegBuilderPreExecute.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Pre-Execute

FfmpegBuilderProres.Description: Encodes the video to the prores format.
FfmpegBuilderProres.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Prores

Fields.Encoder-Help: Which FFmpeg prores encoder to use.
Fields.Quality-Help: 0 for maximum quality, 32 for minimum quality.  9 to 13 are good values to use.

FfmpegBuilderRemoveAttachments.Description: Removes any attachments from the video, if there are any.
FfmpegBuilderRemoveAttachments.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Remove Attachments

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder set to remove attachments.

FfmpegBuilderRemuxToMkv.Description: Remuxes a video file into a MKV container.
FfmpegBuilderRemuxToMkv.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Remux to MKV

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder set to remux to MKV

FfmpegBuilderRemuxToMov.Description: Remuxes a video file into a MOV container.
FfmpegBuilderRemuxToMov.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Remux to MOV

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder set to remux to MOV

FfmpegBuilderRemuxToMP4.Description: Remuxes a video file into a MP4 container.
FfmpegBuilderRemuxToMP4.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Remux to MP4

Fields.UseHvc1-Help: If HVC1 should be used instead of the default of HEV1

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder set to remux to MP4

FfmpegBuilderRemuxToMxf.Description: Remuxes a video file into a MXF container.
FfmpegBuilderRemuxToMxf.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Remux to MXF

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder set to remux to MXF

FfmpegBuilderRemuxToWebm.Description: Remuxes a video file into a WEBM container.
FfmpegBuilderRemuxToWebm.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Remux to WEBM

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder set to remux to WEBM

FfmpegBuilderScaler.Description: This allows you to scale a video to the specified dimensions.  It will retain the aspect ratio of the video so if the video was 1920x1000 it would scale to 1280x668 if you select 720P.
FfmpegBuilderScaler.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Video Scaler

Fields.Force-Help: When checked the video will be force scaled even if the working file is already in this resolution (or near this resolution).
Fields.OnlyIfLarger-Help: The video will only be scaled to this resolution if the video is currently larger than this resolution

Outputs.2: Video was already in/near the scaled resolution

FfmpegBuilderSetDefaultTrack.Description: Set a track as default in the FFmpeg builder.
FfmpegBuilderSetDefaultTrack.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Set Default Track

Fields.Index-Help: The index of the track to set as default, only used if language is not specified.
Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of track to set as default in the FFMPEG Builder

Outputs.2: Failed to set track as default

FfmpegBuilderSetDevice.Description: Sets the device to use for hardware encoding/decoder if the encoder/decoder supports it.
FfmpegBuilderSetDevice.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Set Device

Fields.Device-Help: The path to the device, or leave blank if no device should be specified.

FfmpegBuilderSetFps.Description: Set the frames per second (FPS) in the FFmpeg Builder
FfmpegBuilderSetFps.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Set FPS

Fields.Fps-Help: The desired FPS, if the input FPS and the desired FPS do not match then FFMPEG will convert it, e.g (23.976, 24, 30, 60).
Fields.OnlyIfHigher-Help: If the FPS should be adjusted only if the current FPS is more than the current.

FfmpegBuilderSetTrackTitles.Description: Set track titles based on a formatter in the FFmpeg builder.
FfmpegBuilderSetTrackTitles.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Set Track Titles

Fields.CommentaryFormat-Help: How commentary tracks should be treated, you can use the same formatter as other tracks or use a different method.
Fields.Format-Help: The formatter to use, see _Help_ for more information.
Fields.Separator-Help: The string separator used between format values, this is need to ensure no empty values are kept.
Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of track to set as default in the FFMPEG Builder

FfmpegBuilderStart.Description: Creates an instance of the FFMPEG Builder which can build a FFMPEG argument to then execute with the FFMPEG Executor.
FfmpegBuilderStart.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Start

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder created and ready to add FFMPEG Builder flow elements to

FfmpegBuilderSubtitleBurnIn.Description: Burns subtitles into the video file.
FfmpegBuilderSubtitleBurnIn.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Subtitle Burn-In

Outputs.1: Subtitle found and burned into the video
Outputs.2: No subtitle found to burn in

FfmpegBuilderSubtitleClearDefault.Description: This flow element will clear the default flag from subtitles.
FfmpegBuilderSubtitleClearDefault.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Subtitle Clear Default

Fields.LeaveForced-Help: When checked all forced subtitles will not be touched, they will maintain their original setting.  This is executed prior to 'Set Forced Default' so takes precedent.
Fields.SetForcedDefault-Help: When checked the first subtitle that is found with the Forced field set, will be set as default, all others will have their default flag cleared.

Outputs.1: Subtitles default flags have been changed

FfmpegBuilderSubtitleFormatRemover.Description: Removes subtitles from a video file if found.
FfmpegBuilderSubtitleFormatRemover.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Subtitle Format Remover

Fields.RemoveAll-Help: When checked, all subtitles will be removed from the file, otherwise only those selected below will be

Outputs.1: Subtitles marked for removal in FFMPEG Builder

Fields.Default-Help: If the subtitle should be the default subtitle
Fields.DeleteAfterwards-Help: If the subtitle file should be deleted after being merged
Fields.Forced-Help: If the subtitle should be forced
Fields.Language-Help: Optional [ISO 639-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes) language code for the added subtitle.
Fields.MatchFilename-Help: When checked only subtitles with the same filename as the input file or the working file will be merged
Fields.Pattern-Help: Optional regular expression to match files against.
Fields.Subtitles-Help: Select which subtitles to search for to add
Fields.Title: Title
Fields.Title-Help: The title of the subtitle, if not set the language will be used as the title if found.
Fields.UseSourceDirectory-Help: If checked the original source directory will be searched, otherwise the working directory will be used.

FfmpegBuilderSubtitleTrackRemover.Description:
Allows you to remove subtitles based on either their title or their language codes.

Any language (or title if set to "Use Title") that is blank will NOT be removed regardless of the pattern.
FfmpegBuilderSubtitleTrackRemover.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Subtitle Track Remover

Fields.NotMatching-Help: If subtitles NOT matching the pattern should be removed
Fields.Pattern-Help: A regular expression to match against, eg "eng" to remove English tracks
Fields.UseLanguageCode-Help: If the language code of the audio track should be used instead of the title

Outputs.1: Subtitles marked for removal in FFMPEG Builder

FfmpegBuilderTrackRemover.Description: Allows you to remove tracks based on specified conditions.
FfmpegBuilderTrackRemover.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Track Remover

Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of tracks to reorder in the FFMPEG Builder

FfmpegBuilderTrackSorter.Description: This flow element sorts tracks based on sorting options set by the user.
FfmpegBuilderTrackSorter.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Track Sorter

Fields.SetFirstDefault-Help: If the first track should be set as default after the sort.
Fields.Sorters-Help: Add one or more sorting options to sort the tracks by.
Fields.StreamType-Help: The type of tracks that should be updated

FfmpegBuilderVideo10Bit.Description: Sets FFMPEG Builder to encode the video streams in 10 Bit
FfmpegBuilderVideo10Bit.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Video 10 Bit

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder video streams set to encode in 10 Bit

FfmpegBuilderVideoBitrate.Description: Sets FFMPEG Builder to encode the video given the bitrate
FfmpegBuilderVideoBitrate.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Video Bitrate

Fields.Bitrate-Help: The target bitrate of the video in kilobytes
Fields.Percent-Help: When selected the bitrate will be calculated as a percentage of the current bitrate.

FfmpegBuilderVideoBitrateEncode.Description: Sets the FFMPEG Builder to encode the video with simple to use presets based on Bitrate
FfmpegBuilderVideoBitrateEncode.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Bitrate Encode

Fields.Encoder-Help: The encoder to force to use.  If you specify a hardware encoder that is unavailable, the encode will fail.
Fields.HardwareEncoding-Help: When checked, will test to see if hardware encoders are found on the Processing Node, and if found will use hardware encoding, otherwise will fallback to CPU encoding.

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder video streams set to encode

FfmpegBuilderVideoCodec.Description: Sets FFMPEG Builder to encode the video streams in the specified codec
FfmpegBuilderVideoCodec.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Video Codec

Fields.DisableOtherVideoStreams-Help: When checked if there are multiple video streams in the file, this will remove all but the first video stream from the file once executed.
Fields.Force-Help: Will force a encode of the video even if it is already in the target Video Codec
Fields.VideoCodec-Help:
The video codec the video should be in, for example hevc, h264.
If left empty all original video tracks will be copied.
Fields.VideoCodecParameters-Help: The parameters to use to encode the video, eg. "hevc_nvenc -preset hq -crf 23" to encode into hevc using the HQ preset a constant rate factor of 23 and using NVIDIA hardware acceleration.

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder video streams set to encode
Outputs.2: Video already in target codec, will not re-encode

FfmpegBuilderVideoEncode.Description: Sets the FFMPEG Builder to encode the video with simple to use presets
FfmpegBuilderVideoEncode.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Video Encode

Fields.Encoder-Help: The encoder to force to use.  If you specify a hardware encoder that is unavailable, the encode will fail.
Fields.HardwareEncoding-Help: When checked, will test to see if hardware encoders are found on the Processing Node, and if found will use hardware encoding, otherwise will fallback to CPU encoding.
Fields.Quality-Help:
A logarithmic quality scale, so small changes in the this slider cause large changes in file size/quality.
The lower the number the higher the quality.
See Help for more information

Outputs.1: FFMPEG Builder video streams set to encode

FfmpegBuilderVideoMaxBitrate.Description: Sets FFMPEG Builder limit the bitrate of video
FfmpegBuilderVideoMaxBitrate.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Video Max Bitrate

Fields.Bitrate-Help: The maximum bitrate of the video in kilobytes

FfmpegBuilderVideoTag.Description: Sets a video tag on the file
FfmpegBuilderVideoTag.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Video Tag

Fields.Tag-Help: The tag to add to the video file

FFmpegBuilderWatermark.Description: Adds a watermark to a video file.
FFmpegBuilderWatermark.Label: FFMPEG Builder: Watermark

Fields.Height-Help: Set a custom height of the image, or set to 0 for source height or scaled if width is set.
Fields.Image-Help: The image file to the watermark, for best results use a PNG file.
Fields.Opacity-Help: Adjusts the transparency level of the overlay image, ranging from 0 (fully transparent) to 100 (fully opaque).
Fields.Width-Help: Set a custom width of the image, or set to 0 for source width or scaled if height is set.
Fields.XPos-Help: The position of the watermark on the x-axis
Fields.YPos-Help: The position of the watermark on the y-axis

ReadVideoInfo.Description: Reads the video information from the current working file and updates the vi variables.
ReadVideoInfo.Label: Read Video Info

Outputs.1: File was a video file and information read into flow
Outputs.2: File was not a video file or failed to be read

SubtitleExtractor.Description:
Extracts a single subtitle track and saves it to the specified destination. Supports extraction of SRT, ASS, and SSA formats.
This operation does NOT modify the working file; it will remain unchanged from the input file.

Output 1: Subtitles extracted successfully.
Output 2: No subtitles found to extract.
SubtitleExtractor.Label: Subtitle Extractor

Fields.ExtractAll-Help: Whether to extract all matching subtitles.
Fields.ExtractAsSrtAndSup-Help: Forces extracted subtitles to be saved as .srt for text-based subtitles and .sup for image-based subtitles.
Fields.ForcedOnly-Help: Whether to extract only forced subtitles.
Fields.OnlyTextSubtitles-Help: Whether to extract only text subtitles; all image-based subtitles will be skipped.
Fields.OutputFile-Help: Location to save the extracted subtitle. If left blank, a .srt file will be created in the same location as the original file.
Fields.SetWorkingFile-Help: If checked, the working file will be updated to this extracted subtitle if one is successfully extracted. The original working file will not be deleted.
Fields.Title: Title
Fields.Title-Help: Optionally enter a title. This can be either a regular expression or a string that must appear in the title to match.

VideoAlreadyProcessed.Description: Test if a video file has already been processed by FileFlows
VideoAlreadyProcessed.Label: Video Already Processed

VideoBitCheck.Description: Checks if a video if 8-Bit, 10-Bit, 12-Bit or unknown.
VideoBitCheck.Label: Video Bit Check

VideoBitrateGreaterThan.Description: Tests if a videos bitrate is greater than a given bitrate.
VideoBitrateGreaterThan.Label: Video Bitrate Greater Than

VideoDuration.Description: Tests whether or not the duration of the video matches the given parameters.
VideoDuration.Label: Video Duration

VideoDurationCompare.Description: Compares the original duration of a video with its final duration.
VideoDurationCompare.Label: Video Duration Compare

Fields.AllowedDifference-Help: The allowed time difference between the original duration of the video and the final duration.

Outputs.1: Video is within allowed duration difference
Outputs.2: Video is not within the allowed duration difference

VideoExtractAudio.Description: Extracts audio from a video file and saves it to a file
VideoExtractAudio.Label: Video Extract Audio

Fields.Channels-Help: The number of channels the source track must be in to match.  Set to 0 to skip a channels match.
Fields.Codec-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream codec
Fields.Language-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream language
Fields.NotMatching-Help: If an audio track NOT matching the pattern should be extracted
Fields.OutputBitrate-Help: The bitrate of the extracted audio track
Fields.OutputCodec-Help: The codec to save the extract audio in
Fields.OutputFile-Help:
Where to save the the output file to, e.g. "'{folder.Orig.FullName}\{file.Orig.FileName}.mp3'" to save it with the original file as a mp3 output.
If no extension is set, the output codec will be used to determine the extension.
Fields.SetWorkingFile-Help: When this is checked, if a subtitle is extracted, the working file will be changed to this extracted subtitle.  The original working file will NOT be deleted.
Fields.Title: Title
Fields.Title-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream title

Outputs.1: Audio extracted and saved to a file
Outputs.2: Could not find a track to extract

VideoFile.Description: An input video file that has had its Video Information read and can be processed
VideoFile.Label: Video File

Fields.AnalyzeDuration-Help: Specify how many seconds are analyzed to probe the input
Fields.ProbeSize-Help: The probe size to use in FFMPEG when executing.

VideoHasErrors.Description: Tests if a video file contains any errors
VideoHasErrors.Label: Video Has Errors

Fields.HardwareDecoding-Help: If the an attempt to use hardware decoding should be made.  If not available the execution will proceed just without hardware decoding enabled.

VideoHasStream.Description: Tests if a video file contains a track
VideoHasStream.Label: Video Has Stream

Fields.Channels-Help: The number of channels to test for.  Leave blank to ignore this check
Fields.CheckDeleted-Help: If deleted tracks should also be checked
Fields.Codec-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream codec
Fields.Default-Help: If this stream should be a default stream or not.
Fields.Forced-Help: If this stream should be a forced stream or not.
Fields.Invert-Help: Inverts the result, so effectively becomes `Video Does Not Have Stream`
Fields.Language-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream language
Fields.Stream-Help: The type of stream to look for
Fields.Title: Title
Fields.Title-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream title

Outputs.2: Does not contain the matching track

VideoIs10Bit.Description: Tests if a video file is 10-Bit
VideoIs10Bit.Label: Video Is 10-Bit

VideoIs12Bit.Description: Tests if a video file is 12-Bit
VideoIs12Bit.Label: Video Is 12-Bit

VideoIs8Bit.Description: Tests if a video file is 8-Bit
VideoIs8Bit.Label: Video Is 8-Bit

VideoIsInterlaced.Description: Tests if a video file is interlaced
VideoIsInterlaced.Label: Video Is Interlaced

Fields.Threshold-Help: The percentage of frames detected as interlaced the video must have to be considered interlaced

VideoResolution.Description: Determines a video's resolution and outputs accordingly.
VideoResolution.Label: Video Resolution

Fields.Url-Help: The URL to download, leave empty to use the current working file, if the current working file is not a URL, then this will fail.

Fields.Path-Description: An optional file or variable to parse for Images, if not given then the working file will be parsed.
Fields.Pattern-Help: An optional case insensitive regular expression to match the results against, only results matching this will be accepted.

Outputs.1: Images found and stored in ImageUrls variable

Fields.Path-Description: An optional file or variable to parse for links, if not given then the working file will be parsed.
Fields.Pattern-Help: An optional case insensitive regular expression to match the results against, only results matching this will be accepted.

Outputs.1: Link found and stored in Links variable

AudioNodes.Description: A collection of audio related flow elements to help process audio files.
AudioNodes.Label: Audio

BasicNodes.Description:
Basic flow elements for FileFlows.  This plugin contains basic and common flow elements to process files.
This plugin is required for FileFlows to work.
BasicNodes.Label: Basic

ImageNodes.Description: Flow elements for processing images files.  This plugin contains nodes to convert and manipulate images.
ImageNodes.Label: Image

VideoNodes.Description: Plugin for the processing of video files, including but not limited to video file conversion, video file detection, upscaling, downscaling, and transcoding.
VideoNodes.Label: Video

Web.Description: Plugin that provides Web related flow elements
Web.Label: Web
